usefulItems: large bowl, plastic wrap, serving bowl, 1 plate, paper towel, kitchen thermometer, deep saucepan, slotted spoon, refrigerator, stove top
title: Chicken 65 and green chutney

ingredients.content: 700 g skinless chicken thigh fillets, cut into pieces (3 cm) (see Tips)
20 g fresh mint leaves (approx. ½ bunch) (see Tips)
60 g fresh coriander, stalks and leaves only
4 fresh long green chillies, trimmed, cut into halves and deseeded, if preferred

preparations.content: Place all marinade ingredients, except chicken, into mixing bowl and mix <b>1 min/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a large bowl.

Place large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh chicken into it, then stir well to combine. Cover with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator to marinate for a minimum of  30 minutes (see Tips). Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place pistachios into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add all remaining chutney ingredients and blend <b>1 min/speed 10<b>, until smooth. Transfer into a serving bowl and set aside.
Line a plate with paper towel and set aside.
Place a deep saucepan over high heat and add oil. Heat oil to 180°C (see Tips).
Add curry leaves to saucepan and fry until crisp (approx. 1-2 minutes; leaves will start to pop when done). Remove with a slotted spoon and transfer onto paper towel to drain.

Working in batches, add chicken to saucepan and fry for approx. 3 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Remove chicken using a slotted spoon and transfer onto paper towel to drain. Garnish with fried curry leaves and serve with Green chutney.

hintsAndTricks: To ensure your recipe is gluten free, always check the labels of your products to make sure they don't contain traces of wheat or gluten.
To make your own garlic paste and ginger paste, please refer to the recipes on this recipe chip.
Add mint leaves in handfuls, as the weight of individual leaves aren't heavy enough to register on the scales.
You can use chicken thighs or chicken breast in this recipe.
If marinating chicken for several hours or overnight, remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature.
To test the temperature of your oil, use a kitchen thermometer or drop a small cube of bread into hot oil; when oil is at 180°C, bread will turn golden brown in 15 seconds.
